intro: Hippocratea luteoviridis, commonly known as the yellow-green hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-green flowers that bloom during the dry season. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically clustered in racemose inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in tropical landscapes.
